meanings.def: used as a polite way of asking for something or telling somebody to do something
examples: Please sit down.
Two coffees, please.
Quiet please!
Please could I leave early today?
Could I have a glass of water, please?
Do you have any decaffeinated coffee?
I'd like tea with sugar, please.
I'll have the pasta with salad, please.
Certainly.
I'm sorry, we don't have any left.
Yes, of course. Here you are/​go.

meanings.def: used to add force to a request or statement
examples: Please don't leave me here alone.
Please, please don't forget.
Please, I don't understand what I have to do.

meanings.def: used as a polite way of accepting something
examples: ‘Would you like some help?’ ‘Yes, please.’
‘Coffee?’ ‘Please.’

meanings.def: used to ask somebody to stop behaving badly
examples: Children, please! I'm trying to work.
John! Please!

meanings.def: used when you are replying to somebody who has said something that you think is stupid
examples: Oh, please! You cannot be serious.
please somebody You can't please everybody.
Children are usually easy to please.
He's a difficult man to please.
I was pleased by the results.
There's just no pleasing some people (= some people are impossible to please).
I did it to please my parents.
You must be pleased by their confidence in you.
it pleases somebody to do something It pleased him to see the children playing with their gifts.
She's always very eager to please.
This film is sure to please horror fans.
These guys aim to please and they never fail.
Some children are very difficult to please.
The planning policy failed to please anyone.
The result pleased us enormously.

meanings.def: often used after as or what, where, etc. to mean ‘to want’, ‘to choose’ or ‘to like’ to do something
examples: You may stay as long as you please.
She always does exactly as she pleases.
I'm free now to live wherever I please.

meanings.def: used when politely asking somebody to do something
examples: Take a seat, if you please.

meanings.def: used to say that you are annoyed or surprised at somebody’s actions
examples: And now, if you please, he wants me to rewrite the whole thing!

meanings.def: to be very attractive to look at
used to say that you very much hope or wish that something will happen or not happen
examples: Please God, don't let him be dead.

meanings.def: used to tell somebody that you are annoyed with them and do not care what they do
examples: ‘I don't think I'll bother finishing this.’ ‘Please yourself.’

meanings.def: to be able to do whatever you like
examples: There were no children to cook for, so we could just please ourselves.

idioms.def: used when politely asking somebody to do something
examples: Take a seat, if you please.
And now, if you please, he wants me to rewrite the whole thing!

idioms.def: to be very attractive to look at
used to say that you very much hope or wish that something will happen or not happen
examples: Please God, don't let him be dead.

idioms.def: used to tell somebody that you are annoyed with them and do not care what they do
examples: ‘I don't think I'll bother finishing this.’ ‘Please yourself.’

idioms.idiom: please yourself | do as you please

examples: There were no children to cook for, so we could just please ourselves.
